result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo Dequan Carthel Wade

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deangelo Dequan Carthel Wade appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Deangelo Dequan Carthel Wade.  Attorney Thomas Potter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pre-trial. Court discussed pre-trial concerns and issues on the record. Case remains to be in trial posture. Case adjourned to Branch 15 for jury trial on November 16th, 2022 at 9:00 am.
Order Appointing Counsel for witness, signed and filed.

Defendant Deangelo Dequan Carthel Wade appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Deangelo Dequan Carthel Wade.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case called with co-defendant case 21CM4014. State is in compliance with victim notification.
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties. Due to issues raised, Court orders a final pretrial scheduled prior to the Jury Trial date.
The court appointed Attorney Joseph Domask (upon acceptance) to represent the witness STF; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the witness NOT REQUIRED to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees.
Court grants the defendant's to appear by Zoom for the next scheduled court date.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's Special Motions in Limine, filed.

Defendant Deangelo Dequan Carthel Wade in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Motion to join co-defendant's cases heard.  Argument placed on the record.  Court will grant joinder of co-defendant cases and grants adjournment of trial date.  Parties request new final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-27-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SF. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Deangelo Dequan Carthel Wade in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Motion to Join for Trial.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.
State's Jury instructions received and filed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/25/22 @ 2:30p
